description.narrative: Improve the capacity of businesses to integrate into domestic and international markets through increases in productivity and improvements in corporate governance and the development and application of modern technology and marketing practices. Enhance the capacity of businesses and business associations in terms of their corporate governance capabilities and their application of best practices and technologies to achieve increased production and marketing of products and services. It includes adoption of efficient production processes, improved labor productivity, environmentally-sound management of natural resources and the development of accounting and management systems that can help the company and industry group implement business, labor, product and process standards that enhance business competitiveness. Business capacity development programs may include activities that help men- and women-owned firms and associations respond to these international markets and create regional alliances.

description.narrative: (Armenia): The Local Government Reform Activity (LGRA) supports the Government of Armenia in implementing its territorial and administrative reform. LGRA extends assistance to 16 consolidated pilot municipalities/communities subject to territorial and administrative consolidation. Successful implementation of LGRA continues to enable the newly formed municipalities to build the institutional capacity for effective local revenue generation and resource management. Sustainable public services combined with basic infrastructure will create the necessary prerequisites for local economic development.LGRA takes a cross-sectoral approach to addressing community development in pilots. The assistance will synchronize efforts with USAID's Regional Economic Development - New Economic Development activity (RED-NEO) that will promote SME growth in the regions. LGRA will contribute to the country's proportional economic development and promote local decision-making, which are key to achieving the USG Mission Objective "Democratic Transition Advanced." Institutionalizing local democracy and building resilience in Armenia will enable the Government of Armenia to withstand the Kremlin's influence and contribute to the U.S. foreign policy priority of Championing Democracy, Equity and Inclusion, and promoting greater regional stability.USAID closely coordinates with GIZ, Swiss Development Corporation, World Bank, UNDP, and the Council of Europe to support TARA.

description.narrative: Assist special populations which may be vulnerable or at-risk on a temporary or chronic basis whose needs are not addressed under emergency humanitarian assistance or other programs. These include groups such as the disabled; orphans, children and at-risk youth; victims of trafficking; victims of gender-based violence; refugees, returnees, ethnic minorities, internally displaced or other socially excluded groups; the elderly; and female heads of household. Depending on circumstances, services may intend to protect groups; mitigate adverse conditions they face, or to remove barriers to help integrate them into society. Components may include measures to increase the capacity of local service and advocacy NGOs and/or professional social workers; to establish public/private service delivery partnerships as well as family and community focused service models; to establish effective referral networks; to develop appropriate service protocols and methods for screening prospective recipients; or to improve public understanding and sensitivity to the needs of the vulnerable. While services provided should not exclude victims of trafficking in persons, programs designed specifically for this group fall under the Peace and Security Objective under the Transnational Crime Area and the Trafficking in Persons and Migrant Smuggling Element.

Support civic education and advocacy for reform of laws and practices or directly improving accountability and transparency of governance processes covering various development sectors.

description.narrative: Assist special populations which may be vulnerable or at-risk on a temporary or chronic basis whose needs are not addressed under emergency humanitarian assistance or other programs. These include groups such as the disabled; orphans, children and at-risk youth; victims of trafficking; victims of gender-based violence; refugees, returnees, ethnic minorities, internally displaced or other socially excluded groups; the elderly; and female heads of household. Depending on circumstances, services may intend to protect groups; mitigate adverse conditions they face, or to remove barriers to help integrate them into society. Components may include measures to increase the capacity of local service and advocacy NGOs and/or professional social workers; to establish public/private service delivery partnerships as well as family and community focused service models; to establish effective referral networks; to develop appropriate service protocols and methods for screening prospective recipients; or to improve public understanding and sensitivity to the needs of the vulnerable. While services provided should not exclude victims of trafficking in persons, programs designed specifically for this group fall under the Peace and Security Objective under the Transnational Crime Area and the Trafficking in Persons and Migrant Smuggling Element.

description.narrative: Improve the capacity of businesses to integrate into domestic and international markets through increases in productivity and improvements in corporate governance and the development and application of modern technology and marketing practices. Enhance the capacity of businesses and business associations in terms of their corporate governance capabilities and their application of best practices and technologies to achieve increased production and marketing of products and services. It includes adoption of efficient production processes, improved labor productivity, environmentally-sound management of natural resources and the development of accounting and management systems that can help the company and industry group implement business, labor, product and process standards that enhance business competitiveness. Business capacity development programs may include activities that help men- and women-owned firms and associations respond to these international markets and create regional alliances.

title.narrative: Armenia Market Liberalization and Electricity Trade (MLET)

description.narrative: (Armenia): The program increases Armenia's energy security, lays the foundation for energy investments, and counterbalance Kremlin malign influence, contributing to CAATSA Goal 7. It supports the NSS's priority actions that reinforce economic ties with partners threatened by competitors, as well as Objective 2.4 of the EUR JRS, and Objectives 3.1 and 3.2 of the ICS, which seek to increase energy security and integration.The program promotes regional energy integration with Georgia by supporting legal-regulatory reforms; accelerating the implementation of market liberalization mechanisms; and strengthening Armenia-Georgia dialogue on cross-border electricity trade.Electricity market reforms and interconnection with Georgia are fundamental to improving Armenia's investment climate, and will provide more regulatory certainty. Energy reforms will enhance transparency, reduce corruption, and attract investments for sector diversification.The project will assist the Armenian government, Public Service Regulatory Commission (PSRC) and market participants in developing electricity market rules and software to accelerate the implementation of liberalization mechanisms. It will develop and implement the pilot phase of the Market Management System Software and help finalize the Network Codes and Market Rules.MLET will also support the PSRC to develop data transparency requirements and market monitoring procedures and indicators for effective monitoring of market players. Finally, MLET will assist in preparing Armenia's 2036 Energy Strategy based on the Least Cost Energy Development Plan (LCEDP). In line with the LCEDP, which identifies significant economic advantages for expansion of solar and other variable renewable energy generation, the project will support the development of regulatory frameworks for renewable energy auctions and other competitive bid mechanisms and provide advisory services. . .. .. .

description.narrative: Improve the capacity of businesses to integrate into domestic and international markets through increases in productivity and improvements in corporate governance and the development and application of modern technology and marketing practices. Enhance the capacity of businesses and business associations in terms of their corporate governance capabilities and their application of best practices and technologies to achieve increased production and marketing of products and services. It includes adoption of efficient production processes, improved labor productivity, environmentally-sound management of natural resources and the development of accounting and management systems that can help the company and industry group implement business, labor, product and process standards that enhance business competitiveness. Business capacity development programs may include activities that help men- and women-owned firms and associations respond to these international markets and create regional alliances.

description.narrative: Provide technical assistance and training to strengthen sub-national government functions, including development of budgets, local revenue raising, provision of local public services, community planning, participation, and implementation of laws, regulations, policies, and programs. Develop and/or strengthen associations of local governments and/or local government officials.

title.narrative: Rural Economic Development – New Economic Opportunities

description.narrative: (Armenia): The U.S. National Security Strategy seeks to Promote American Prosperity through priority actions that facilitate new market opportunities, including through partnerships with countries as they incentivize private sector growth. Objective 2.3 of EUR's Joint Regional Strategy includes efforts to foster entrepreneurship and innovation. Mission Objective 3.2 of the Integrated Country Strategy for Armenia seeks to promote economic growth by increasing the competitiveness of targeted sectors. The program also contributes to CAATSA Goal 8 by promoting economic resilience (20%). RED-NEO promotes inclusive, sustainable economic growth and bolsters resilience and livelihoods in targeted rural areas. The activity builds the capacity of rural small and medium enterprises (SMEs), cooperatives, and networks across the horticulture value chain. Through technical assistance, training and small grants RED-NEO: (i) strengthens the market system for agricultural produce by facilitating market linkages between producers and buyers; (ii) encourages local economic development by establishing networks; and (iii) builds the skills and capacity of rural enterprises and cooperatives to generate income. RED-NEO will support at least 100 businesses in 60 communities across Armenia. Gender and youth sensitive value chain promotion approaches will encourage the participation of women and youth in entrepreneurship campaigns, marketing, and co-financing schemes. About 3,000 farmers will be trained in different aspects of business development and horticulture value chains.

description.narrative: Assist special populations which may be vulnerable or at-risk on a temporary or chronic basis whose needs are not addressed under emergency humanitarian assistance or other programs. These include groups such as the disabled; orphans, children and at-risk youth; victims of trafficking; victims of gender-based violence; refugees, returnees, ethnic minorities, internally displaced or other socially excluded groups; the elderly; and female heads of household. Depending on circumstances, services may intend to protect groups; mitigate adverse conditions they face, or to remove barriers to help integrate them into society. Components may include measures to increase the capacity of local service and advocacy NGOs and/or professional social workers; to establish public/private service delivery partnerships as well as family and community focused service models; to establish effective referral networks; to develop appropriate service protocols and methods for screening prospective recipients; or to improve public understanding and sensitivity to the needs of the vulnerable. While services provided should not exclude victims of trafficking in persons, programs designed specifically for this group fall under the Peace and Security Objective under the Transnational Crime Area and the Trafficking in Persons and Migrant Smuggling Element.

description.narrative: (Armenia): .Currently in Armenia, there is a mismatch in the labor market between supply and demand. The Workforce Development activity promotes efforts to address the significant labor market gaps and low levels of female and youth labor market participation, including reducing the gap between the skills of the workforce and the needs of employers. It also focuses on improving societal misconceptions about vocational education and employment. The overarching goal of the activity is to improve the soft and technical skills of youth and women and increase their linkages to occupations in key and/or growing sectors by reducing barriers to entry in the labor market. Through training and technical assistance the activity: (1) reduces the gap between the skills of the workforce and the needs of employers; (2) shapes societal perceptions to support effective labor market participation; and (3) improves the operating and enabling legal regulatory environment of labor market development. The principles underlying the strategic and operational approach of the activity include: positive youth development; gender equality; private sector engagement; local ownership and sustainability; and data-driven decision making..The Interim National Security Strategic Guidance seeks to Advance American Interests by renewing partnerships, investing in development assistance to create new markets and mitigate the root causes of instability, and by championing equity and inclusion. The activity also contributes to JSP Goal 2 and Mission Objective 2.1 of the Integrated Country Strategy for Armenia by seeking to advance youth leadership and inclusive economic growth, including through workforce improvements to meet market demands. . .

title.narrative: Improved Water Management for Sustainable Economic Growth

description.narrative: (Armenia): This activity aligns with the Biden Administration's Interim National Security Strategic Guidance call to invest in water security to improve lives globally and advance U.S. national interests. Armenia needs to shift to a new, sustainable paradigm for water management and use. Communities across the country are already facing severe water availability issues. The activity will promote sustainable water management and use by improving the country's analytical tools, supporting governance reforms, and promoting best practices and innovative approaches. .The activity will support the government of Armenia and relevant stakeholders to ensure that water management systems and institutions implement sound, evidence-based policies and practices in an equitable manner. This includes deepening the skills of the Ministry of Environment and other stakeholders to use modern approaches to data gathering and analysis, and support data driven decision-making on water allocation and management..Conservation practices are a key bottleneck to equitable and sustainable access to water. To address this, the activity will demonstrate water conservation technologies in cooperation with the private sector and scientific institutions via small-scale pilot projects. These projects are intended to benefit communities as well as serve as demonstrators for uptake within the private sector. The activity will support the rehabilitation of water infrastructure in communities to increase equitable access to water

description.narrative: Improve the capacity of businesses to integrate into domestic and international markets through increases in productivity and improvements in corporate governance and the development and application of modern technology and marketing practices. Enhance the capacity of businesses and business associations in terms of their corporate governance capabilities and their application of best practices and technologies to achieve increased production and marketing of products and services. It includes adoption of efficient production processes, improved labor productivity, environmentally-sound management of natural resources and the development of accounting and management systems that can help the company and industry group implement business, labor, product and process standards that enhance business competitiveness. Business capacity development programs may include activities that help men- and women-owned firms and associations respond to these international markets and create regional alliances.

description.narrative: Assist special populations which may be vulnerable or at-risk on a temporary or chronic basis whose needs are not addressed under emergency humanitarian assistance or other programs. These include groups such as the disabled; orphans, children and at-risk youth; victims of trafficking; victims of gender-based violence; refugees, returnees, ethnic minorities, internally displaced or other socially excluded groups; the elderly; and female heads of household. Depending on circumstances, services may intend to protect groups; mitigate adverse conditions they face, or to remove barriers to help integrate them into society. Components may include measures to increase the capacity of local service and advocacy NGOs and/or professional social workers; to establish public/private service delivery partnerships as well as family and community focused service models; to establish effective referral networks; to develop appropriate service protocols and methods for screening prospective recipients; or to improve public understanding and sensitivity to the needs of the vulnerable. While services provided should not exclude victims of trafficking in persons, programs designed specifically for this group fall under the Peace and Security Objective under the Transnational Crime Area and the Trafficking in Persons and Migrant Smuggling Element.

description.narrative: the South Caucasus Transportation Assessment to support greater regional economic connectivity, which will bolster peace and reconciliation efforts. This project will conduct a preliminary assessment to identify and evaluate viable options to improve regional transport connections in the South Caucasus...The six-month assessment will assist in better understanding the feasibility, costs, and estimated economic benefits of various transportation routes in Armenia. The study will bring to the region decades of international expertise in solving some of the worlds most difficult infrastructure challenges, the results of which are intended to inform ongoing efforts by Armenia and Azerbaijan to unblock transportation connections in the region...USAID is proud to support this initial assessment as a first step for the region to develop economic and trade connections. Economically sound, climate-sensitive connectivity and transportation links are necessary for the countries of the South Caucasus to flourish. USAID looks forward to the results of the assessment and the possibilities it brings for the South Caucasus region.

description.narrative: Reduce the threat or impact of violent conflict and promote the peaceful resolution of differences, mitigate violence if it has already broken out, or establish a framework for peace and reconciliation. This is done by identifying the causes of conflict and state failure; supporting early responses that address the causes and consequences of instability and conflict; and developing long lasting solutions to the problems that drive conflict. This includes support for processes and mechanisms for reconciliation and conflict mitigation no matter what the source of the conflict may be, though this may require integration with other elements.

description.narrative: Improve the capacity of businesses to integrate into domestic and international markets through increases in productivity and improvements in corporate governance and the development and application of modern technology and marketing practices. Enhance the capacity of businesses and business associations in terms of their corporate governance capabilities and their application of best practices and technologies to achieve increased production and marketing of products and services. It includes adoption of efficient production processes, improved labor productivity, environmentally-sound management of natural resources and the development of accounting and management systems that can help the company and industry group implement business, labor, product and process standards that enhance business competitiveness. Business capacity development programs may include activities that help men- and women-owned firms and associations respond to these international markets and create regional alliances.

description.narrative: The goal of the Civic Advocacy Support Program (CASP), a USAID-funded program implemented by Counterpart International, was to strengthen the organizational and performance capacity of three Intermediary Service Organizations (ISOs) and six core advocacy partner Nongovernmental Organizations (NGOs). Counterpart worked with these nine organizations to develop strategies for long-term organizational sustainability and a more diversified funding base. - See more at: http://www.counterpart.org/our-work/projects/civic-advocacy-support-program-in-armenia#sthash.yNZmY6I3.dpuf

Assistance for the Independent States of the Former Soviet Union

description.narrative: Strengthen the legal, regulatory, institutional, and information environment which protects and enables the growth in associational life and the development of independent and sustainable civil society organizations (CSOs). Build the capacity of civil society organizations to act as agents for reform and support their participation in democratic decision-making through articulating and representing their members interests, engaging in service delivery, and advocating for issues which become part of the public agenda and are reflected in public policies. Encourage the strengthening of a civic culture which supports democratic institutions and processes, active participation in political and civic life, and the civic virtues of tolerance, pluralism, compromise, trust, and respect for individual rights, including gender equality.

usg:treasury-account.usg:main-account: Assistance for the Independent States of the Former Soviet Union

title.narrative: Core Media Support Program for Armenia (CMSPA)

description.narrative: The primary mission of this four year project, implemented by IREX and funded by USAID, is to foster self sustainability in the Armenian media sector. The main element of the program is designed to assist commercially viable targeted independent media outlets through the provision of loans. However the CMSPA also includes elements that contribute to the development of the banking sector, promote economic development, and improve the profitability and business acumen of targeted media outlets. The project includes a comprehensive cooperative targeted media development initiative that will encourage the development of cooperative network synergies and move targeted media outlets towards loan qualification.

sector.narrative: Media and free flow of information

title.narrative: Political Process Development in Armenia project

description.narrative: The three-year project implemented by the National Democratic Institute for International Affairs (NDI), Political Process Developmen t in Armenia, began January 9, 2009, and ended on January 9, 2012. NDI was an implementing partner, along with IFES, of the CEPPS (Consortium for Elections and Political Process Strengthening) program. Given the context, USAID proposed a program in which NDI would both improve the ability of citizens to effectively participate in political processes as members of political parties and help political parties develop their ability to take part in parliamentary and presidential elections scheduled for 2012 and 2013 respectively.

title.narrative: Advancing Armenias Election Management and Democratic Culture (AAEM-DC) Program

description.narrative: The purpose of the project was to strengthen the administration of electoral processes and assist the electoral administration to meet international standards for free and fair elections through its support of the Central Election Commission (CEC)and the Passport and Visa Department of the Police of the Republic of Armenia (OVIR) which is responsible for maintaining the national voter list. The purpose of the evaluation is to assess the success of the project and to evaluate its effectiveness in achieving its programmatic goals and USAID/Armenias strategic objectives.

description.narrative: Support and strengthen the negotiation process and implement peace and reconciliation processes, accords and ceasefire agreements at track levels 1, 2 and 3, including support to indigenous peacebuilding efforts. For a peace/negotiations process to have a chance of success, it must entail building trust in the process, between parties, and among their constituents, with a special focus on including women. Illustrative activities include negotiation training; platform development; public opinion polling; facilitation activities; elder statesmen engagement; provision of international expert advice and knowledge; financial support to parties; multi-stakeholder dialogues; assistance with the design of peacebuilding training programs; support and maintenance of agreed verification mechanisms; support to complaint tracking mechanisms; and work with local and national government representatives to bring them closer to their constituencies.

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

description.narrative: Strengthen the legal, regulatory, institutional, and information environment which protects and enables the growth in associational life and the development of independent and sustainable civil society organizations (CSOs). Build the capacity of civil society organizations to act as agents for reform and support their participation in democratic decision-making through articulating and representing their members interests, engaging in service delivery, and advocating for issues which become part of the public agenda and are reflected in public policies. Encourage the strengthening of a civic culture which supports democratic institutions and processes, active participation in political and civic life, and the civic virtues of tolerance, pluralism, compromise, trust, and respect for individual rights, including gender equality.

title.narrative: USAID/Armenia Labor Market Integration of People with Disabilities

description.narrative: The goal of the USAID Labor Market Integration of People with Disabilities project, also known as Disability and Work (DAW) is to promote equal employment opportunities and access to employment as a basic human right for people with disabilities. The project will ensure that no decisions concerning disabled people are made without their active participation.

description.narrative: (Armenia): The objective of PRP is to empower rural communities with economic growth perspectives by: identifying economic value creation opportunities; equipping them with entrepreneurial skills; improving access to finance and markets; and upgrading infrastructure. This year the activity plans to create more than 145 permanent and temporary jobs; increase revenue generated by assisted companies by 15%; have 70 startup entrepreneurs participate in "Successful Start" campaigns; provide loans through the SMEDNC loan guarantee facility; provide 12 technology upgrade grants; consult 20 SMEs on marketing, sales, negotiation skills, identification of customers; complete 4 Small-Scale Infrastructure projects; train 70 farmers at Farm Service Centers(FSC); finance 80 farmers through FSC Agro-Credit. The activity helps reduce migration and dependence on Russian remittances.

description.narrative: (Armenia): The goal of the activity is to increase rural employment by tackling constraints to economic development. The set of interventions include: assessing competitiveness and value chain; non-financial and financial support; and small-scale infrastructure (SSI) development. This year, ARDI will: create at least 270 permanent and temporary jobs; implement about 10 SSI projects; establish and support 15 startups; establish about 100 new linkages for beneficiaries; organize networking and promotion events; conduct training on cooperative marketing tools, production technology, environment, business development and cooperatives solutions; and organize in-country best practice exchange visits and business fairs for beneficiaries. By increasing economic opportunities in rural areas, ARDI helps reduce out-migration to Russia and dependence on Russian remittances.

description.narrative: Improve the capacity of businesses to integrate into domestic and international markets through increases in productivity and improvements in corporate governance and the development and application of modern technology and marketing practices. Enhance the capacity of businesses and business associations in terms of their corporate governance capabilities and their application of best practices and technologies to achieve increased production and marketing of products and services. It includes adoption of efficient production processes, improved labor productivity, environmentally-sound management of natural resources and the development of accounting and management systems that can help the company and industry group implement business, labor, product and process standards that enhance business competitiveness. Business capacity development programs may include activities that help men- and women-owned firms and associations respond to these international markets and create regional alliances.

title.narrative: Territorial and Administrative Reform of Armenia (TARA)

description.narrative: The existing territorial and administrative division of Armenia as well as limited decentralisation in Armenia are considerable impediments to development of local governance, effective service provision, and efficient use of scarce financial resources. In order to address these challenges, the Government of the Republic of Armenia (GoA) has launched a large-scale structural change process, the Territorial and Administrative Reform of Armenia (TARA). It was started in three pilot clusters (Dilijan, Tumanyan and Tatev) in 2015-2016 after holding local referenda in those municipalities. The local elections were held in February 2016 marking the official establishment of the three enlarged municipalities. In 2016, additional 15 pilot clusters were formed. Thus, at present 18 new enlarged municipalities are formed in Armenia embracing 140 former municipalities, concluding the piloting phase of TARA. This reduced the number of municipalities to 793 (915-140+18).

title.narrative: Support to the Agribusiness Training Center

description.narrative: (Armenia): The activity assists the Agribusiness Training Center and International Center of Agribusiness Research and Education and builds their capacity to serve as leading educational and research institutions and centers of excellence in Armenia and in the region. It promotes linkages with U.S. Universities, develops a qualified workforce that meets the demands of the Armenian economy, and helps reduce the out-migration. .. In the upcoming year, Virginia Tech will continue to assist the activity in implementing recommendations for organizational and financial sustainability, including support for establishing and capitalizing a long-term endowment fund. The activity will also introduce new courses on modern tools for agricultural management, support the implementation of a "Food Safety" Certificate program with the Penn State University, and assess the possibility of a dual degree with a U.S. university for a Masters in Agribusiness program.

title.narrative: Advanced Civil Society for Accountable Governance Project: Decentralization Reform Consortium

description.narrative: (Armenia): Assistance will promote civic engagement, increased civil society's ability to contribute to the formulation and execution of decentralization policy, and expanded citizen understanding of public policies and reforms in territorial administration and local governance. This is achieved through technical assistance, training, and grants. Civil Society consortium members will improve their ability to analyze, monitor, and assess the impact of decentralization reforms, and hold government officials accountable.The prime partner formed a consortium with 5 CSOs to implement the activity which is geared to:-strengthen civil society's capacity to engage citizens in local self-government-strengthen civil society's capacity to monitor central and local government institutions -increase citizens' access to independent and reliable information-create an enabling environment for the civil society...........

description.narrative: (Armenia): This activity increases citizen access to independent and reliable sources of information on priority reforms and broader issues integral to democracy. It also creates public demand for quality journalism through media literacy. It builds on three pillars: enhancing media's capacity to serve as a watchdog over the reform process; ensuring high-quality reporting to expand the alternative narrative in media; and building public demand for independent, balanced, and in-depth information on both major and underreported issues.This is achieved through technical assistance, training, and grants to media outlets

description.narrative: Improve the capacity of businesses to integrate into domestic and international markets through increases in productivity and improvements in corporate governance and the development and application of modern technology and marketing practices. Enhance the capacity of businesses and business associations in terms of their corporate governance capabilities and their application of best practices and technologies to achieve increased production and marketing of products and services. It includes adoption of efficient production processes, improved labor productivity, environmentally-sound management of natural resources and the development of accounting and management systems that can help the company and industry group implement business, labor, product and process standards that enhance business competitiveness. Business capacity development programs may include activities that help men- and women-owned firms and associations respond to these international markets and create regional alliances.

title.narrative: Establishment of Innovative Solutions and Technologies Center

description.narrative: (Armenia): The objective of the Innovative Solutions and Technologies Center (ISTC) activity is to develop and strengthen the educational capabilities of Armenian higher educational institutions in IT and enhance their research performance and potential. ISTC will create a favorable environment for IT and High-Tech businesses to grow, and provide infrastructure and resources to enterprises in other sectors as well. The Center will aim to accomplish the following:-Modernizing the IT curricula and laboratory equipment at Yerevan State University (YSU);-Expanding YSU's experience to modernize curricula in at least four other educational institutions in Armenia;-Upgrading faculty qualifications;-Increasing the number of qualified IT and High-Tech workforce participants in Armenia;-Making Armenia a regional IT and High-Tech Center of Excellence. The activity will stimulate technical labor productivity and contribute to innovation within several high potential sectors of the Armenian economy.

title.narrative: Promoting Transparency and Accountability through Advanced Civil Society

description.narrative: (Armenia): This activity reduces the space for corruption by mobilizing citizens in public oversight at national and local levels, providing policy input for improved transparency and accountability, ensuring citizens' access to reliable information on the status of reforms to address corruption, and improving the ability of local CSOs to monitor and assess the impact of reforms in an evidenced-based manner. This is achieved through technical assistance and training. The intended result is to strengthen CSO capacity to hold the government accountable and for citizens to be less tolerant of corrupt practices. It is envisioned that findings of watchdog CSOs and investigative reporters put corrupt practices and systemic issues under the spotlight, thus necessitating government action. This contributes to a more level field for investment, which in turn can foster opportunities for U.S. economic interests and potential investment in the country.

title.narrative: Support to Social Sector Reforms in Armenia

description.narrative: (Armenia): USAID will support a local civil society consortium for social service reforms. The consortium will advocate for citizens' interests, analyze and inform citizens about the financial, economic, social and political impact of the social service reforms, with a particular focus on pension reform and child protection. Key results include increasing public participation and an increase in transparency and accountability in government decision making processes.Assistance will increase citizens' contributions to the formulation and implementation of social sector policies, and expand citizen understanding of reforms. It will also promote new types of civic engagement, and increase civil societies ability to contribute to the formulation of social policy. In addition, consortium members will improve their ability to analyze decentralization reforms in a systematic, evidenced-based manner, monitor reform processes, assess the impact, and hold government officials accountable.

description.narrative: Increase the availability and use of proven life-saving interventions that address the major killers of mothers and children and improve their health and nutrition status, including effective maternity care and management of obstetric complications; prevention services including newborn care, routine immunization, polio eradication, safe water and hygiene, and micronutrients; improved maternal, infant and young child feeding; and treatment of life-threatening childhood illnesses.

description.narrative: Strengthen the legal, regulatory, institutional, and information environment which protects and enables the growth in associational life and the development of independent and sustainable civil society organizations (CSOs). Build the capacity of civil society organizations to act as agents for reform and support their participation in democratic decision-making through articulating and representing their members interests, engaging in service delivery, and advocating for issues which become part of the public agenda and are reflected in public policies. Encourage the strengthening of a civic culture which supports democratic institutions and processes, active participation in political and civic life, and the civic virtues of tolerance, pluralism, compromise, trust, and respect for individual rights, including gender equality.

title.narrative: Participatory Utilization and Resource Efficiency of Water (PURE - Water) Activity

description.narrative: The goal of the PURE Water project is to reduce groundwater abstraction in the Ararat Valley and to increase water productivity, quality and efficiency of water use through public awareness campaigns and increased citizen participation. The project will facilitate improvements in the policy and regulatory framework to foster responsible use of water resources, encourage individuals and civil society to participate in and oversee water resource management, and help design small-scale infrastructure projects.

description.narrative: Under the BRIDGE program, Global Communities provided vocational training to local residents in the construction sector and then employed trainees on public works projects that would benefit the greater community. Upon the program completion, Global Communities worked with employment centers to place its graduates in the private sector. Community investment and buy-in was ensured by engaging local government and business stakeholders as partners and requiring communities share part of the construction costs.

title.narrative: Enterprise Development and Market Competitiveness (EDMC) Project

description.narrative: EDMC project is a 5-year intervention to raise incomes and employment by promoting growth in 4 value chains (IT, pharmaceuticals, food processing and tourism) export potential. The goal of the project is to assist to develop a more competitive and diversified private sector. The objectives in the target VCs are: develop competitive enterprises and VCs by stimulating innovation; enhance workforce skills; accelerate new enterprise formation; improve access to finance; address shortcomings in the business environment. The critical needs for microenterprises include: lack of marketing skills and market information; lack of export orientation; access to finance (particularly in rural areas). EDMC assistance focused on microenterprises to improve their business sophistication, develop innovative products, enter new markets. EDMC help companies improve managerial and marketing skills, assist with promotion of products and services, help improve financial management and business planning.

description.narrative: (Armenia): FED promotes efficiency and capacity within financial institutions to enhance access to credit for SMEs, especially in rural areas and USAID select industries; assists in policy and regulatory reforms; stimulates product innovation, cost-effective solutions to expand access to financial services; and supports pension reforms implementation through strengthening capital markets. It closely works with and complements assistance provided by the World Bank, IMF, and EBRD.The project will have the following results: access to loans increased for targeted sectors; capital markets deepened to create long term investment opportunities; financial sector regulatory and policy framework improved; collateral registry legislation finalized; leasing and export credit guarantee products introduced; pension reform legislation revised; energy efficiency lending capacity of banks and UCOs enhanced; feasibility study to introduce mobile solutions in Armenia conducted.

description.narrative: (Armenia): USAID will continue to provide technical assistance to the GOAM to implement the new pension system and make it fiscally sound and sustainable. It will also support the GOAM's efforts to design and develop an Integrated Social Services system (ISS) with a focus on areas linked to the implementation of the pension reform. The assistance is in line with country's strategic plan to reduce poverty, strengthen social services institutions, and empower Armenian citizens to exercise their social protection rights and responsibilities.To achieve this, the program will provide technical assistance for human and institutional capacity building to ensure that the pension system, which is a key part of Armenia's integrated social services system, is well-managed, regulated, and supervised. It will also promote increased civic engagement to ensure that users and beneficiaries of the social services system receive the care and services needed in a timely, efficient, and effective manner.

description.narrative: Assist special populations which may be vulnerable or at-risk on a temporary or chronic basis whose needs are not addressed under emergency humanitarian assistance or other programs. These include groups such as the disabled; orphans, children and at-risk youth; victims of trafficking; victims of gender-based violence; refugees, returnees, ethnic minorities, internally displaced or other socially excluded groups; the elderly; and female heads of household. Depending on circumstances, services may intend to protect groups; mitigate adverse conditions they face, or to remove barriers to help integrate them into society. Components may include measures to increase the capacity of local service and advocacy NGOs and/or professional social workers; to establish public/private service delivery partnerships as well as family and community focused service models; to establish effective referral networks; to develop appropriate service protocols and methods for screening prospective recipients; or to improve public understanding and sensitivity to the needs of the vulnerable. While services provided should not exclude victims of trafficking in persons, programs designed specifically for this group fall under the Peace and Security Objective under the Transnational Crime Area and the Trafficking in Persons and Migrant Smuggling Element.

Build the capacity of civil society organizations to act as agents for reform and support their participation in democratic decision-making through articulating and representing their members interests, engaging in service delivery, and advocating for issues which become part of the public agenda and are reflected in public policies. Encourage the strengthening of a civic culture which supports democratic institutions and processes, active participation in political and civic life, and the civic virtues of tolerance, pluralism, compromise, trust, and respect for individual rights, including gender equality.

title.narrative: Improving Infant and Young Child Health and Nutrition in Armenia Project

description.narrative: The goal of the project is to reduce malnutrition in women and children during the first 1,000 days from conception to 24 months of age. Within the framework of the project, partners support the local primary health care facilities to provide quality services in health and nutrition, organize public outreach events and training sessions for parents of infants and young children to improve child nutrition and care, as well as work towards improvement of child nutrition monitoring and evaluation mechanisms at community, regional and national levels.

title.narrative: Toward Social Inclusion of Vulnerable Children in Armenia

description.narrative: (Armenia): The program will support the Government of Armenia (GOAM) to advance country's social protection systems through:Direct assistance to implement a national child care reform that stops the flow of children placed into residential institutions; systematically reduces the number of children in residential institutional care; and develops alternative family-based and community-based social services for vulnerable children and their families. The program will build the GOAM's institutional and human resource capacity to ensure a smooth transition to community-based alternative services, as well as share the one-time transition costs for this reform. Support to integrated social services (ISS) in Armenia. The assistance will complement the World Bank's program to establish one-stop shops for social services for clusters of communities outside of Yerevan. It will also strengthen the role of community social workers and will incorporate child protection and pension services into ISS.

description.narrative: Improve the capacity and sustainability of civil and criminal justice sector actors and institutions, enhance coordination amongst them, develop citizen demand for an effective and accountable justice system, and develop associations to advocate for all citizens. Justice sector actors and institutions include: police, border security, prosecutors, forensics experts, judges, court personnel, public defenders, corrections personnel, private bar, law schools, legal professional associations, and training institutions for each of them. Work towards an equitable justice system by ensuring equality before the law, fair trial standards, and other elements of procedural fairness. Ensure more equitable access to justice through innovations within and beyond the state system and through improvements in the quality and quantity of justice services, with a particular focus on women, youth, the poor, and other marginalized or vulnerable groups. Programs primarily focused on trafficking in persons or migrant smuggling should be included in element 5.3 under the Transnational Crime area in the Peace and Security Objective.

description.narrative: The goal of the project is to increase the level of informed and effective civic activism at the local and national levels, along with more participatory, decentralized, efficient and responsive local governance that supports the democratic process. This objective is supported by three programmatic objectives: Component 1. Local Government and Civil Society CollaborationFostering Participatory Community Strategic Planning for Community Development and Improved Local Democracy. Component 2. Support for Civic Participation, Advocacy and Citizen Activism. Component 3. Facilitation of Decentralization and Local Fiscal Autonomy.

description.narrative: Improve the capacity of businesses to integrate into domestic and international markets through increases in productivity and improvements in corporate governance and the development and application of modern technology and marketing practices. Enhance the capacity of businesses and business associations in terms of their corporate governance capabilities and their application of best practices and technologies to achieve increased production and marketing of products and services. title.narrative: " My Armenia" Tourism Sector Assistance project

description.narrative: Armenia's tourism industry is at the center of the host government and USG attention. Currently USAID is assisting with development of new tour products and tourism services in rural areas of Armenia that help maximize tourist experiences. The long term vision for the tourism sector includes activities that will lead to Armenia being recognized as unique tourist destination, especially for cultural tourism, offering a wide range of tourist products and leading to increasing tourists arriving and staying longer. The goal for the next several years will be to improve tourism branding and marketing, and create new cultural tourism products, and further donor cooperation.

description.narrative: Clean Energy and Water Program - The purpose of this activity is to provide assistance to Armenias energy and water Sectors on activities which have the prospect for improving Armenia's energy and water security. Armenia lacks a systematic approach to energy development and water management, which hinders national capability to address the issues of water scarcity and sustainable water and energy development that are fundamental to national energy security, climate change mitigation and adaptation, and availability of resources for vulnerable populations. Therefore this activity will provide technical support to promote integrated energy and water planning at the sub-basin level; advise the Government of Armenia (GOA) on issues regarding sustainable hydropower development and water management; and facilitate the use of clean energy and water management practices and technologies at the community- and enterprise-level through outreach and technical support.

title.narrative: Evaluation of ABA-ROLI, CEPPS, SATR AND SSIP Projects

description.narrative: IBTCI conducted five simultaneous evaluations of USAID-assisted projects in the Republic of Armenia which focused on various sectors including democracy and governance. The evaluations included: Mid-term Evaluation of the Armenia-Turkey Rapprochement (SATR) Project; Final Evaluation of the Political Process Development in Armenia Project (CEPPS-NDI); Final Evaluation of the Advancing Armenias Elections Management and Democratic Culture Project (CEPPS-IFES); Final Evaluation of the Small Scale Infrastructure Program (SSIP); and Mid-term Evaluation of the Armenia Rule of Law Program (ABA-ROLI). Each of these five evaluations provided an assessment of the effectiveness, efficiency, and sustainability of the USAID initiatives. The evaluations utilized both qualitative and quantitative methods including desk review, key informant interviews, focus group discussions, and nationwide surveys. The information gathered was analyzed and formulated into individual evaluation reports. Each of these reports provided an assessment of the extent to which the projects were able to achieve intended/set goals and objectives and how future activities can be made more effective. These evaluations will be used by USAID for project planning over the next three to five years.

description.narrative: (Armenia): The Support for the National Assembly (NA) Program will strengthen the National Assembly's (NA) institutional capacity, particularly at the level of the parliamentary committees. It will also promote the objectives of other USAID programs by assisting relevant sector-specific committees where bills are reviewed.Support will strengthen procedures that will enhance the ability of committees, and the NA as a whole, to draft and review legislation, obtain input from constituents and experts, and conduct oversight over the government's programs, policies, budgets, and expenditures. The USG also provides technical assistance to the committee and units responsible for in-house operations in advancing the NA's Rules of Procedure.Results:-Improved NA committee outreach capacity-Improved NA committee oversight capacityRules of Procedure within the NA expand to open greater opportunities for varied political forces, improving representational and oversight functions

title.narrative: Advanced Science & Partnerships for Integrated Resource Development

description.narrative: (Armenia): The activity supports sustainable water management in the Ararat Valley through science, technology, innovation and partnership. Poor water management has led to water scarcity in the Valley, straining the surrounding communities and jeopardizing the cooling system of the Metsamor Nuclear Power Plant. The activity will help preserve and increase water availability for the communities and energy generation facilities in the Ararat Valley. The development of new generation facilities, including Small Modular Nuclear Reactors, will foster opportunities for U.S. economic interests. ..In the upcoming year, the activity will support the development of science-based tools for sustainable resource management to be piloted with fish farms and communities, including: (a) a groundwater model of the Ararat Valley; (b) a Decision Support System for the Ararat Valley catchment area; and c) an online groundwater use monitoring system.

title.narrative: Assistance to Energy Sector to Strengthen Energy Security and Regional Integration (ESRI) project

description.narrative: The purpose of the USAID sponsored Assistance to Energy Sector to Strengthen Energy Security and Regional Integration (ESRI) project is to provide assistance to Armenias Energy Sector on activities which have the prospect for improving Armenia's energy independence and security. The three key elements of energy security for Armenia are: i) Securing diversified energy sources, including nuclear; ii) Securing investment to ensure efficient, economically and environmentally sustainable renewable energy generation and usage; iii) Supporting country's energy systems regional integration.

title.narrative: Maternal and Child Health Improvement Project (NOVA 2)

description.narrative: In Armenia, RTI works with partners IntraHealth International and Save the Children to improve maternal and child health services and increase access to family planning and reproductive health services. The RTI team is helping create Schools of Motherhood within existing Maternal Health Centers, which encourage expectant mothers to access pre-natal care while offering information and training on pregnancy danger signs, newborn and infant care, exclusive breastfeeding, fitness, healthy lifestyles, and postpartum family planning. The schools promote male involvement in class attendance, with a curriculum that provides partners with the skills to support and participate in the pregnancy and child rearing process.
